pros: Insurance benefits if you have kiddos and bring them to a Children's provider are wonderful Staff on certain floors are a joy to work with
cons: I am currently very content in my current position

job_title: Child Life Specialist in Omaha, NE
pros: Chance to really utilize child life skills
cons: Management problems and lack of support for the profession from other hospital staff

job_title: Manager, Talent Acquisition in Omaha, NE
pros: I love working at Children's and being a part of something bigger than myself. We have devoted a lot of work and attention to our culture over the last few years and I'm excited to see where we can continue to enhance things. Clinicians have multiple places to choose from in Omaha, but in addition to being a pediatric hospital, our employees and culture continue to separate us from everyone else.
cons: Working to be more proactive in everything we do, rather than reactive.

review_title: Great Mission + Great Culture = Great Place to Work!
job_title: Strategic Talent Outreach Consultant in Omaha, NE
pros: Culture, Leadership, Work/Life Balance, Connectivity to the Mission, Great Team Members, Lots of Opportunity for Career Growth
cons: Demanding at Times, Sometimes Pediatric Healthcare Can Be Emotionally Challenging

pros: The Culture is by far unmatched by any other organization!
cons: I enjoy working at Children's Hospital and I don't see any downsides.

review_title: The BEST place to work in Omaha
pros: Great salary Great parking Great benefits package
cons: The food in the cafeteria could be better, but we are fortunate to have a cafeteria on site.

pros: Talented people who love what they do, so they stay with the organization for a long time. Helping kids is the key.
cons: Constant growth and change can be challenging.

pros: Working at Childrens has been a great opportunity. I have started and three weeks in I'm being possibly offered another position in my field. The supervisors are so helpful and friendly. So understanding, I do love it so much already.
cons: Everyone isn’t friendly or approachable at times. But, who knows maybe they’re having a bad day. It’s not very diverse. When I see other people that “look like me” they’re surprised that another one of us work here.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Omaha, NE
pros: Organization cares about employees, common bonuses, tuition reimbursement
cons: Parking, slow hiring process sometimes

pros:
PTO even if you are part time
Decently competitive pay
Management shows you that you are appreciated

Management seems all over the place
Under construction

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Omaha, NE
pros: Staff is friendly and helpful
cons: The parking is terrible at times.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Omaha, NE
pros:
Good atmosphere team oriented 
Doctors very nice
cons: Management needs to listen to employees and stop micromanaging

job_title: Clinical Nurse Supervisor in Omaha, NE
pros:
-People first culture
-Good benefits/competitive pay
-Great leadership development programs
-Just Culture is used by management to make sure an environment of inclusion and fairness is used when it comes to errors or employee concerns
-Makes patient safety a top priority
cons: Because this is a hospital and a 24/7 operation, there is inflexibility with schedules if you are on the patient care side. Working weekends and holidays is a must.

review_title: Good starring ratios. Too much floating
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Omaha, NE
pros: Great staffing ratios - 4 pt in med surg, 1-2 in ICU, success sharing bonuses
cons: Tons of floating, managers that don't care about concerns, mandatory overtime during busy season

job_title: Certfied Pharmacy Technician in Omaha, NE

review_title: Great place to work, everyone truly cares about the mission.
job_title: Senior Human Resources Specialist in Omaha, NE
pros: Great coworkers and management team.
cons: The parking situation was rough during all the construction but it was worth it as many more families will be able to seek treatment at Childrens!

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Omaha, NE
pros: Positive atmosphere and they take great care of their patients
cons: Work/life balance can be a bit difficult due to staff shortages

pros: Co-workers make this a great place to work, everyone helps each other. Wonderful patient families
cons: Little room for personal and career growth if you’re non-nursing staff, this would be area for improvement

pros: working with kids and their family
cons: Doctors are allowed to treat their staff like crap.  If staff brings it up they are told "Give it time she will get better." or "It took about 10 months before she was nice to me."  In one week 4 staff members gave their notice they were leaving.

pros: Fair compensation. Works well with employee to allow for meeting family needs balanced against work life.
cons: No issues to mention at this time

pros:
Supportive work environment. 
Professional developmental opportunities. 
Team atmosphere.
cons: Not a con - necessary have a special interest in Pediatrics, patient facing and non- clinical roles

review_title: Excellent Patient Care, Subpar Employee Care
pros: Every employee at Children's is there for the right reasons-patient care. It is a fun work environment as your co-workers truly care about the mission.
cons: Administration heirarchy. Decisions take way too long to make for simple matters. The pay is below average for many positions especially those that are not patient care.

pros: fulfulling work, great benefits, opportunities for bedside staff to advance or be involved in process improvement/research/committees.
cons: ASN nurses not eligible for some positions (Magnet criteria)

pros:
Somewhat flexible in their scheduling, can make up missed hours on occasion without getting in trouble.

Benefits are good and there are a variety of them, but the deductibles are still high even when you don't choose the high deductible health plan.

Tuition reimbursement is available.

They don't charge you a copay to have your children seen at any of their facilities, including the ER.
cons:
They will not negotiate pay no matter how much experience you have for the position.

Negative overtones in the work environment, almost hostile.

All HR policies are based on nurse staffing requirements and needs rather than considering that not all employees are nurses and non-essential departments outside of nursing shouldn't be held to those requirements.

Tuition reimbursement is minimal compared to the actual cost of college courses per year. 

Yearly raises are negligible and do not keep up with the cost of living in this city.

review_title: wonderful with children, horrible with employees
pros:
This organization has a wonderful medical staff. The medical personnel, in fact all the employees, care deeply about children and making them healthy and happy. 
It is very unfortunate that senior management does not care about the non medical personnel at all. They give themselves huge salariies and don't even pay the administrative personnel fair wages, let alone superior ones. Working conditions are terrible for most admins and many haven't had raises in years because no one has bothered to find out what fair salaries are in the open market. Personnel stay because they care for the children, but 90 percent of them are underpaid and working what amounts to two jobs in a 40 hour week so that senior management can take home huge bonuses and raises every year.
cons: It is very unfortunate that senior management does not care about the non medical personnel at all. They give themselves huge salariies and don't even pay the administrative personnel fair wages, let alone superior ones. Working conditions are terrible for most admins and many haven't had raises in years because no one has bothered to find out what fair salaries are in the open market. Personnel stay because they care for the children, but 90 percent of them are underpaid and working what amounts to two jobs in a 40 hour week so that senior management can take home huge bonuses and raises every year.People are afraid to complain because they will end up fired---constructive dismissal is a way of life there.

pros: Friendly staff great patients good culture
cons: Depends what floor you work on

pros: Benefits. PTO, sick time, nice hospital
cons: Bad management. There’s a lot of catty telling on people.

pros: New center for children being built
cons: Consistency of care is difficult due to the influx of new nursing and staff

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Omaha, NE
pros: No visits from management in department
cons: No hazard pay for Covid-19

review_title: Amazing growth and change in this organization!
pros: I love how positive and happy everyone is to work here! As a medical Assistant, things are continuously changing and growing, and I love that our management has kept us in the loop over the last year to encourage our input on changes and to make our role standard. Being a Medical Assistant at Children's is an honor, as I enjoy being a vital portion of the Child's patient experience, and time here at the clinics. Children's SPC developed an MA/CCP committee, to bring together the Medical Assistant and Child Care Partner roles to have a constant voice. This has increased my job satisfaction immensely as I know that leadership cares about me and my role.
cons: I don't have a lot of cons to mention. The only thing I would say, is that I feel like the organization has come a long way in the last 2 years on listening to their employees. I think that the communication is so much better than before, and I actually feel like I'm a part of the change, instead of having to adjust to it.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Omaha, NE
pros: The RT Department Manager and leadership was amazing!  They ran a great department and created a great work environment.
cons: This hospital is 100% Nursing driven.  If you are a clinical employee and are not a Nurse, be prepared to be treated like a janitor.  Respiratory Therapists are not respected for their education and expertise here.  in recent history this was even worse than it was when I left, but the hospital still has a long ways to go.  Also, Nursing Leadership and Physicians need to get rid of the small town attitudes and "we've always done it this way" mentalities.  Lastly, I took a 10% pay-cut when I started here.  They have never been competitive for wages, even after they increased wages due to market adjustments.  After our wage bumps, we were still 5-10% below average.

review_title: Revolving door for ER Midlevels and Nurses
pros: Good benefits.  Children's matches what you put into your retirement fund.  12 hour shifts allow you to get your hours in quickly.  Never on-call.
cons:
Physicians are the priority, even though midlevels do all the work.  Not all physicians are good at their jobs and you sometimes have to fight with them to make patients receive appropriate care.  You are constantly reminded that your patients aren't really your patients, they are the attending's patients so you have to follow their plan.  

You work 2 holidays a year, & it consists of 2 days or nights in a row.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Omaha, NE
pros: The co-workers are outstanding.  They try to support, uplift and guide each other to complete the mission. The overall organization has a wonderful goal and great benefits.
cons: The managers in Material Management lack knowledge and the ability to guide, communicate and support their workers. The turn over is ridiculous and yet they still have no clue on why.  There are a lot of great people who leave because of the manager. As a manager, discussing fellow workers to subordinates is not ok and bullying in the work place from management is happening quite often.  Human Resources has continued to not do a thing about it.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros: The employees generally have a very good attitude and seem to want to be there. Management keep employees up to date on continuing education.
cons: All of the Child Care Partners on the Med Surg floors have to float to other units frequently without a pay incentive. If you are hired as a float pool CCP you get paid more, but you do not get paid more if you float as a CCP from a Med Surg unit.

review_title: One of the worst job experiences I've ever had
pros: The Hospital is very interested in patient satisfaction
cons: I received very poor training and the employees were less than friendly or helpful.  They have a no overtime rule period.  As a new employee, I was expected to learn and complete work in the same amount of time as employees that have been there over 10 years.  I think Children's is a good organization and I was proud to be a part of the Hospital but embarrassed to have worked in the Finance department.. I would not recommend working in Finance.  Also, health insurance very poor.

pros: Pay is good. Many opportunities to move within the company. Benefits available for part time employees. The company employs very competent people.
cons: Employee turnover is high. When a clinic is short 2-4 staff members for over a year and the remaining employees are under pressure to keep up and do, they believe that clinic does not need to be fully staffed because they busted their hind ends off to get the job done. Administration is out of touch with what happens within the clinics and continue to add more responsibilities to the employees without providing additional staff.

review_title: Will never work in adult care again!
pros: Environment, culture, support from administration.  The culture at Children's is a constant reminder and testament to our mission..."So that all children may have a better chance to live."  All of the employees at this organization, from providers to kitchen staff, are focused on the children we serve.
cons: Small private hospital = not as competitive with salaries.  Salaries are lower than surrounding hospital systems, but it is understandable because Children's is not a large hospital.  The benefit of working in the environment and culture that Children's provides is worth sacrificing a few dollars/hour to be happier and more engaged at work.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Omaha, NE
pros: Organization has a great mission to better the lives of all children.  Almost everyone who works there truly cares for patients and their families. They also provided  average benefits for employees.
cons: A very tough work environment when it comes to balancing a personal life with work. Employees are dedicated and happily work evenings and holidays thus spending time away from their families. Childrens doesn't value long term employees and has a history of terminating employees after decades of experience.

pros: The benefits are good.  The mission is great.  The pay is low.
cons: The management team is dysfunctional.  They lack integrity and common decency.  They would rather line their own pockets than take care of the employees that are on the front line.  They pretend to care about the patient experience, but they only do so that they can get their own bonuses.  They don't really care about anyone but themselves.  The front line staff are the ones who care and know their jobs the best.  Let them do their jobs!

review_title: Excellent place to work.  Lots of passion!
pros: Employees are very passionate about their work.  Patients and families are awesome.  Children's Hospital & Medical Center is always moving forward and constantly adding new services.  On-sight employee clinic offers free clinic visits to employees.  Free fitness center available.  Lots of growth potential for nursing staff.
cons: Salary lower than surrounding hospitals.  You have to be prepared for high census and high acuity care.  It's not a job for everyone but incredibly rewarding if you're the right fit for the culture!

review_title: Good place to work...only if you are a nurse
pros: I like that we are able to work with children.  The specialty clinics are full of knowledgeable doctors.  They work well with each other to provide patient with the best care and outcome possible.
cons: If you do not have a nursing degree, children's does not offer very many incentives and opportunities for advancement.  Recognitions and management options require a bachelor's degree in nursing before you would be considered.

pros: Great support for learning, great night managers, pay is competitive with other hospitals and states, wonderful atmosphere, and overall focus on children and bettering their lives. Also, open and non-punitive as far as suggestions for care of employees and patients/families.
cons: Staffing is tight right now but they are open about working on it.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros: Awesome director! Great mid town location. Great benefits.
cons:
They are slow to weed out horrible managers/directors though.
They do not review salaries in the market often enough. I am stuck at my current highest possible salary so I get my raise in one lump sum with 40% taken out for taxes because it is taxed as a bonus. Any company would have to do this.

pros: Hospital staff is helpful and friendly
cons: Bullying in the finance office, supervisors have their pets. You could WFH during COVID with your own equipment. Masking and social distancing were a joke when you were in the office.

review_title: Come to Children's, Stay for Life
job_title: Supervisor, Technical Training in Omaha, NE
pros: Children's is such an amazing place to work, from the staff, leadership, and especially our patients and families.  Such a positive group!
cons: Children's is growing so are going through  those common growing pains.  Growth is also a good thing since it also brings a certain level of job security.

pros: Working within Children's is truly a partnership where your voice is heard, and every role collaborates in problem solving and decision making, to ensure we achieve, high employee satisfaction, attract and retain top talent, improve patient outcomes, and advance nursing standards and practice.
cons: I do not have any

review_title: Just say no to the clinic
pros: Working with children and their families
cons: Attitudes every where you turn. Doctors can be extremely rude and their attitudes are brushed off by management and told to not take it personally and just give them time. There is absolutely no reason for staff to be treated badly all because they are doctors.

review_title: Culture could be the downfall of a great place to work
pros: Great team work, benefits, pediatric-based
cons: Not racially or culturally diverse; Executive levels are standoffish and snobby

pros: I love working at Children's Hospital.  Great culture in which everyone seems very friendly and supportive.  I like seeing all the children and families and knowing what we do and what I do supports the mission.
cons: Nothing.  I have no complaints.

pros: I worked here for a year in a very stressful environment, but still loved my job. People were great, managers were good. I was part time, so no access to benefits or PTO. Pay was good, I received a decent shift differential for working nights, weekends and holidays.
cons: Holiday assignments weren't always completely fair.

pros: I love working at Children's and being a part of such an amazing mission.  My coworkers are like family and my manager is great.  No complaints.
cons: I honestly don't have any complaints.  It's been a great opportunity and I hope to continue my career here forever.

pros: Wonderful management, great team-work, friendly staff, great learning opportunities, room for growth and continued education & certifications supported
cons:
Can be short staffed and over worked at times.
Floating often is not ideal.

pros: Children's does an excellent job of taking care of their employees! There's also the fact that you get to work with some really awesome kids!
cons: When a child you are close to passes away. It's heartbreaking

pros: Were very nice I was happy to be there. Learned many things while I was here that were beneficial
cons: Pay was low could he better.

pros: Amazing team, benefits and population that we care for.
cons: Sometimes leave 30 minutes late because some kids that come in are very sick.

pros: Going through a lot of growth right now, but still feels like a family oriented place to work with great "values."
cons: Not much. Communication sometimes takes awhile to trickle down to front line employees.

pros: Good compensation and Benefit, Work/Life balance was pretty good.
cons: Average management (in my department). I did not like their health insurance. Don't know if there are some improvements now.

job_title: Information Security Officer in Omaha, NE
pros: Amazing culture for employees. Treated like family. Truly a fabulous place to work!
cons: No downsides. Children's really focuses on its employees.

pros: Excellent  specialty patient experience
cons: The pay was very poor

pros: Decent benefits and salary, free employee health clinic
cons: Inadequate systems, incompetent managers, no work life balance,  hostile work environment,  no pension, no job security, no support from HR

pros: Great culture and the people are wonderful
cons: Not a lot of growth opportunities

job_title: Nurse Case Manager in Omaha, NE
pros:
Lifelong friendships
Safety priority all the time
cons: Employee satisfaction has seemed to diminish overtime and length in field

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Omaha, NE
pros: Great company to work for.
cons: Nigght shift, other than that it is an awesome company

pros: It's the best place for kids.
cons: Horrible culture. They lack mission and vision. Unfair treatment.

review_title: Too small to be so dysfunctional!
pros: Absolutely nothing that I can think of.
cons: Horrible leadership.  No one wants to be in charge and create procedures to follow.
